1461707730046140421.text: Now you know your ABCs, the House just passed the BBB! 🎶

1461707559774138371.text:
Z is for Zero-Emission Rebates.

The Build Back Better Act will provide up to 100% rebates to eligible contractors to replace current vehicles with zero-emission ones, as well as rebates for purchasing, installing and operating related infrastructure.

1461707491906138117.text:
Y is for YouthBuild.

The Build Back Better Act will provide $15M for YouthBuild -- a community based pre-apprenticeship program under the US DOL providing job training for our young people -- to improve access to services, stipends and wages.

1461707420733001728.text:
X is for Xciting!

The Build Back Better Act is an exciting investment that will grow our economy and protect our planet for generations to come.

1461707419524993024.text:
W is for Water.

The Build Back Better Act will fund $97 million for rural water and wastewater programs for insular areas, persistent poverty counties and Tribal lands.

1461707418388373505.text:
V is for Veteran Services.

The Build Back Better Act will invest $2.4 billion into the Department of Veteran Affairs nationwide -- ensuring that our veterans are taken care of and honored for their service.

1461707417218134026.text:
U is for Universal Pre-K.

The Build Back Better Act will ensure every 3-5 year old keiki in the United States is eligible for high-quality preschool education, ensuring our keiki are prepared for kindergarten and beyond.

1461707415964028929.text:
T is for Taxing the Rich.

The Build Back Better Act will establish accountability for the biggest corporations and wealthiest billionaires to ensure they pay their fair share.

1461707414915502091.text:
S is for Science.

The Build Back Better Act funds research capacity building at minority serving institutions through the @NSF.

1461707413749477383.text:
R is for Rural Energy.

The Build Back Better Act will invest in Rural Electric Cooperatives and the Rural Energy for America Program -- ensuring our energy grids meet the needs of our communities.

1461707412323377152.text:
Q is for Qualified Nonprofits.

The Build Back Better Act provides $873 million in grants to qualified nonprofit organizations for rural development through the Rural Prosperity Development Grant program.

1461707411165700105.text:
P is for Prescription Drug Prices.

The Build Back Better Act will finally let Medicare negotiate drug prices -- lowering costs and increasing access to the medications Americans need.

1461707410092003343.text:
O is for Oceans.

The Build Back Better Act will provide $400,000 in grants to repair, replace and upgrade marine hatcheries and fisheries.

1461707408892477454.text:
N is for Native Hawaiian Consultation.

The Build Back Better Act will provide federal consultation and coordination for Native communities on land use, development and infrastructure -- something our Native Hawaiian communities have requested for years.

1461707407684517901.text:
M is for Maternal Health.

The Build Back Better Act will require state Medicaid and CHIP programs to provide 12 months of continuous care for postpartum women, ensuring that all women receive the postpartum care that they need.

1461707406606483460.text:
L is for Land-Grant Universities.

The Build Back Better Act will authorize $1 billion in grants for land-grant universities, including Native Hawaiian serving institutions like the University of Hawai‘i.

1461707405511778308.text:
K is for Kūpuna.

The Build Back Better Act will provide $655M to support home and community based care for our kūpuna -- ensuring that they can be supported at home.

1461707404178079750.text:
J is for Jobs Here at Home.

The Build Back Better Act will ensure clean energy technology will be built in the United States, protecting our climate and creating hundreds of thousands of good jobs in our communities.

1461707402953248776.text:
I is for Indigenous Language Teacher Training.

The Build Back Better Act will provide $20M in grants to prepare, train, and offer professional development to Indigenous language teachers and Indigenous language early childhood educators.

1461707401808289793.text:
H is for Hearing Aids.

The Build Back Better Act will expand Medicare coverage to include hearing care -- ensuring our kūpuna are not priced out of the hearing aids they need.

1461707400528994314.text:
G is for Grants.

The Build Back Better Act will authorize $150M for grants to states, municipalities and nonprofits to address cesspools and to construct, repair or replace decentralized wastewater systems.

1461707399425929225.text:
F is for Food Security.

The Build Back Better Act will expand free school meals to 8.7 million children during the school year and provide support for eligible families to purchase food during the summer break.

1461707398297661452.text:
E is for Environmental Justice.

The Build Back Better Act will be the largest legislative initiative to combat climate change in American history and will focus on addressing the needs of frontline and underserved communities.

1461707397089697799.text:
D is for DREAMers.

The Build Back Better Act will expand eligibility for Title IV financial aid programs, like Pell Grants, to DACA recipients and TPS & DED holders.

1461707395927842823.text:
C is for Child Tax Credit.

The Build Back Better Act will extend the Child Tax Credit for an additional year -- continuing to keep our keiki fed, clothed and housed.

1461707394573123594.text:
B is for Better Business Opportunities.

The Build Back Better Act will create a grant for nonprofits to teach veterans about the federal procurement process -- supporting veteran small business contractors.

1461707393356767238.text:
A is for Affordable Housing.

The Build Back Better Act will enable the construction, rehabilitation and improvement of more than 1 million affordable homes.

1461707391901257731.text:
The Build Back Better Act is a once-in-a-generation bill, making the robust and equitable investments our communities need.

To highlight a few of these great initiatives, let’s learn the the ABCs of BBB:
